field.name: summary
field.value: Windsor injects disposed instance with PerWcfOperation lifestyle into user classes

field.name: description
field.value: Quite often I get ObjectDisposedException in quite high load environment (~100 request/sec). This happens because Windsor provides already disposed instance of NHibernate session to my queries.

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: which version is that? Of Windsor and WCF Facility (build number)

comment.author: Dmitry.Kryuchkov
comment.text: Windsor 2.5.3 and latest revision of WcfFacility from github. Commit:108681b3904f361971e9799f1d3b07351ab62a46

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text:
I did reproduce it, but honestly I'm not too sure what the reason for that behaviour was.
Anyway, I ran it against lastest build of WCF Facility (which uses Windsor 3) and it seems to be running just fine so I hope the issue is resolved.

comment.author: Dmitry.Kryuchkov
comment.text: Yeah, I've been watching through WcfFacility codebase and I didn't find out any reason either. Well, let's wait for Windsor 3 release. By the way, will WcfFacility be released simultaneously with Windsor 3?
